name: src/jira.js

unknown.tagValue:
Wrapper for the JIRA Rest Api
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/6.4.8/

properties.name: protocol
properties.description:
What protocol to use to connect to
jira? Ex: http|https

properties.name: host
properties.description:
What host is this tool connecting to for the jira
instance? Ex: jira.somehost.com

properties.name: port
properties.description:
What port is this tool connecting to jira with? Only needed for
none standard ports. Ex: 8080, 3000, etc

properties.name: username
properties.description:
Specify a username for this tool to authenticate all
requests with.

properties.name: password
properties.description:
Specify a password for this tool to authenticate all
requests with. Cloud users need to generate an [API token](https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/api-tokens-938839638.html) for this value.

properties.name: apiVersion
properties.description:
What version of the jira rest api is the instance the
tool is connecting to?

properties.name: base
properties.description:
What other url parts exist, if any, before the rest/api/
section?

properties.name: intermediatePath
properties.description:
If specified, overwrites the default rest/api/version
section of the uri

properties.name: strictSSL
properties.description:
Does this tool require each request to be
authenticated?  Defaults to true.

properties.name: request
properties.description:
What method does this tool use to make its requests?
Defaults to request from request-promise

properties.name: timeout
properties.description:
Integer containing the number of milliseconds to wait for a
server to send response headers (and start the response body) before aborting the request. Note
that if the underlying TCP connection cannot be established, the OS-wide TCP connection timeout
will overrule the timeout option ([the default in Linux can be anywhere from 20-120 *
seconds](http://www.sekuda.com/overriding_the_default_linux_kernel_20_second_tcp_socket_connect_timeout)).

properties.name: webhookVersion
properties.description:
What webhook version does this api wrapper need to
hit?

properties.name: greenhopperVersion
properties.description:
What webhook version does this api wrapper need
to hit?

properties.name: ca
properties.description: Specify a CA certificate

properties.name: oauth
properties.description:
Specify an OAuth object for this tool to authenticate all requests
using OAuth.

properties.name: bearer
properties.description: Specify an OAuth bearer token to authenticate all requests with.

properties.name: consumer_key
properties.description: The consumer entered in Jira Preferences.

properties.name: consumer_secret
properties.description: The private RSA file.

properties.name: access_token
properties.description: The generated access token.

properties.name: access_token_secret
properties.description: The generated access toke secret.

properties.name: signature_method
properties.description:
[signature_method=RSA-SHA1] - OAuth signurate methode
Possible values RSA-SHA1, HMAC-SHA1, PLAINTEXT. Jira Cloud supports only RSA-SHA1.

properties.name: pathname
properties.description: The url after the specific functions path

properties.name: query
properties.description: An object of all query parameters

properties.name: intermediatePath
properties.description: Overwrites with specified path

unknown.tagValue: Creates a requestOptions object based on the default template for one

params.name: options
params.description: an object containing fields and formatting how the

properties.name: method
properties.description: HTTP Request Method. ie GET, POST, PUT, DELETE

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathname

params.name: options
params.description: an object containing path information

properties.name: pathname
properties.description: The url after the /rest/api/version

properties.name: query
properties.description: a query object

properties.name: intermediatePath
properties.description: If specified will overwrite the /rest/api/version section

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathName

params.name: options
params.description: An options object specifying uri information

properties.name: pathname
properties.description: The url after the /rest/webhooks

properties.name: intermediatePath
properties.description: If specified will overwrite the /rest/webhooks section

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathName

params.name: options
params.description: The url after the /rest/

properties.name: pathname
properties.description: The url after the /rest/api/version

properties.name: query
properties.description: a query object

properties.name: intermediatePath
properties.description: will overwrite the /rest/greenhopper/version section

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathname
{pathname, query, intermediatePath} obj1

params.name: pathname
params.description: obj1.pathname - The url after the /rest/api/version

params.name: query
params.description: obj1.query - a query object

params.name: intermediatePath
params.description:
obj1.intermediatePath - If specified will overwrite the
/rest/dev-status/latest/issue/detail section

unknown.tagValue: Creates a URI object for a given pathname
Does a request based on the requestOptions object

params.name: requestOptions
params.description:
fields on this object get posted as a request header for
requests to jira

unknown.tagValue:
Find an issue in jira
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id290709)

params.name: issueNumber
params.description: The issue number to search for including the project key

params.name: expand
params.description: The resource expansion to return additional fields in the response

params.name: fields
params.description: Comma separated list of field ids or keys to retrieve

params.name: properties
params.description: Comma separated list of properties to retrieve

params.name: fieldsByKeys
params.description: False by default, used to retrieve fields by key instead of id

unknown.tagValue:
Download an attachment
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id288524)

params.name: attachment
params.description: the attachment

unknown.tagValue:
Remove the attachment
[Jira Doc](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-attachments/#api-rest-api-3-attachment-id-delete)

params.name: attachmentId
params.description: the attachment id

unknown.tagValue:
Get the unresolved issue count
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id288524)

params.name: version
params.description:
the version of your product you want to find the unresolved
issues of.

params.description: key for the project

params.name: project
params.description: with specs

params.name: remoteLink

params.name: project
params.description: A project key to get versions for

name: getVersion
description:
Get details of single Version in project
[Jira Doc](https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/version-getVersion)

params.name: version
params.description: The id of this version

params.name: version
params.description: an object of the new version

params.name: version
params.description: an new object of the version to update

params.name: versionId
params.description: the ID of the version to delete

params.name: moveFixIssuesToId
params.description:
when provided, existing fixVersions will be moved
                to this ID. Otherwise, the deleted version will be removed from all
                issue fixVersions.

params.name: moveAffectedIssuesToId
params.description:
when provided, existing affectedVersions will
                be moved to this ID. Otherwise, the deleted version will be removed
                from all issue affectedVersions.

params.name: versionId
params.description: the ID of the version to delete

params.name: position
params.description: an object of the new position

name: searchJira
description:
Pass a search query to Jira
[Jira Doc](https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e4424)

params.name: searchString
params.description: jira query string in JQL

params.name: optional
params.description: object containing any of the following properties

params.name: optional.startAt
params.description: : optional starting index number

params.name: optional.maxResults
params.description:
: optional The maximum number of items to
                 return per page. To manage page size, Jira may return fewer items per
                 page where a large number of fields are requested.

params.name: optional.fields
params.description: : optional array of string names of desired fields

params.name: optional.expand
params.description: : optional array of string names of desired expand nodes

params.name: user
params.description: Properly Formatted User object

properties.name: username
properties.description:
(DEPRECATED) A query string used to search username, name or
e-mail address

properties.name: query
properties.description:
A query string that is matched against user attributes
(displayName, and emailAddress) to find relevant users. The string can match the prefix of
the attribute's value. For example, query=john matches a user with a displayName of John
Smith and a user with an emailAddress of johnson@example.com. Required, unless accountId
or property is specified.

properties.name: startAt
properties.description: The index of the first user to return (0-based)

properties.name: maxResults
properties.description: The maximum number of users to return

properties.name: includeActive
properties.description:
If true, then active users are included
in the results

properties.name: includeInactive
properties.description:
If true, then inactive users
are included in the results

name: getUsersInGroup
description: Get all users in group on Jira

params.name: groupname
params.description: A query string used to search users in group

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first user to return (0-based)

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of users to return (defaults to 50).

name: getUsersIssues
description:
Get issues related to a user
[Jira Doc](http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#id296043)

params.name: open
params.description: determines if only open issues should be returned

params.name: accountId
params.description: The accountId of user to search for

params.name: expand
params.description: The expand for additional info (groups,applicationRoles)

name: getUsers

Filters results to sprints in specified states.
Valid values: future, active, closed.

params.name: boardId
params.description: Id of board to retrieve

params.name: sprintId
params.description: Id of sprint to retrieve

params.name: startAt
params.description: The starting index of the returned issues. Base index: 0.

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of issues to return per page. Default: 50.

params.name: jql
params.description: Filters results using a JQL query.

params.name: validateQuery
params.description:
Specifies whether to validate the JQL query or not.
Default: true.

params.name: fields
params.description: The list of fields to return for each issue.

params.name: boardId
params.description: Id of board to retrieve

params.name: startAt
params.description: The starting index of the returned versions. Base index: 0.

params.name: maxResults
params.description:
The maximum number of versions to return per page.
Default: 50.

params.name: released
params.description:
Filters results to versions that are either released or
unreleased.Valid values: true, false.

params.name: filterId
params.description: Id of filter to retrieve

params.name: epicIdOrKey
params.description: Id of epic to retrieve

params.name: epicIdOrKey
params.description: Id of epic to retrieve

params.name: body
params.description: value to set, for objects make sure to stringify first

params.name: epicId
params.description: Id of epic to retrieve, specify 'none' to get issues without an epic.

params.name: startAt
params.description: The starting index of the returned issues. Base index: 0.

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of issues to return per page. Default: 50.

params.name: jql
params.description: Filters results using a JQL query.

params.name: validateQuery
params.description:
Specifies whether to validate the JQL query or not.
Default: true.

params.name: fields
params.description: The list of fields to return for each issue.

params.name: epicIdOrKey
params.description: Id of epic to move issue to, or 'none' to remove from epic

params.name: issues
params.description: array of issues to move

params.name: epicIdOrKey
params.description: Id of epic

params.name: body
params.description: value to set

unknown.tagValue:
Get server info
[Jira Doc](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-api-2-serverInfo-get)

params.name: optional
params.description: object containing any of the following properties

params.name: optional.projectIds
params.description: : optional Array of project ids to return metadata for

params.name: optional.projectKeys
params.description: : optional Array of project keys to return metadata for

params.name: optional.issuetypeIds
params.description: : optional Array of issuetype ids to return metadata for

params.name: optional.issuetypeNames
params.description:
: optional Array of issuetype names to return metadata
for

params.name: optional.expand
params.description:
: optional Include additional information about issue
metadata. Valid value is 'projects.issuetypes.fields'
Get metadata for creating an issue.
[Jira Doc](https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-createmeta-get)

params.name: endpoint
params.description: Rest API endpoint

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "jira-client",
  "version": "6.22.0",
  "description": "Wrapper for the JIRA API",
  "author": "Steven Surowiec <steven.surowiec@gmail.com>",
  "contributors": [
    "Chris Moultrie <chris@moultrie.org>",
    "Lucas Vogelsang <l@lucasvo.com>",
    "Matt Smith <mtscout6+node-jira@gmail.com>",
    "Anson Wayman <kanoyugoro+node-jira@gmail.com>"
  ],
  "homepage": "http://github.com/jira-node/node-jira-client",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "http://github.com/jira-node/node-jira-client"
  },
  "engine": {
    "node": ">=10.0.0"
  },
  "main": "./lib/jira.js",
  "files": [
    "lib",
    "docs",
    "LICENSE.md",
    "README.md"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.6.0",
    "request": "^2.88.0",
    "request-promise": "^4.1.1"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "build": "rm -rf lib && babel src --out-dir lib",
    "docs-build": "rm -rf docs && esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "lint": "eslint ./",
    "test": "npm run lint && mocha --require @babel/register && npm run docs-build",
    "prepublishOnly": "npm run build && npm run docs-build",
    "release": "release"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/cli": "^7.6.0",
    "@babel/core": "^7.6.0",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.6.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.6.0",
    "@babel/register": "^7.6.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^10.0.3",
    "babel-plugin-add-module-exports": "^1.0.0",
    "chai": "^4.2.0",
    "chai-as-promised": "^7.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^7.7.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^18.0.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.18.2",
    "eslint-plugin-mocha": "^8.0.0",
    "mocha": "^8.1.1",
    "release-script": "^1.0.1"
  },
  "release-script": {
    "docsRepo": "git@github.com:jira-node/jira-node.github.io.git",
    "docsRoot": "docs/",
    "tmpDocsRepo": "tmp-docs-repo"
  }
}
name: package.json
